Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: MATERIALS AND METHODS : Three groups , comprised of 21 cocaine naive participants ( CN ) , 30 occasional cocaine ( OC ) , and 48 regular recreational cocaine ( RC ) users , were compared .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| cocaine naive participants |
| occasional cocaine |
| regular recreational cocaine users |

The three groups mentioned in the paragraph consist of individuals with different levels of cocaine use. The term "cocaine naive participants" refers to individuals who have not used cocaine before. "Occasional cocaine" and "regular recreational cocaine users" refer to individuals who use cocaine occasionally and regularly for recreational purposes, respectively. Therefore, "cocaine" is the disease entity in this paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| cocaine |

After re-evaluating the paragraph, I realized that the only term that clearly refers to a disease is "cocaine." The other terms, "cocaine naive participants," "occasional cocaine," and "regular recreational cocaine users," are descriptions of the participants' level of cocaine use, not the disease itself. Therefore, the valid disease entity in this paragraph is "cocaine."
